rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The tract of lissauer and its possible relation to the pain pathway
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The tract of Lissauer has long been associated with pain, but the exact pathway of this important sensation has been far from clear. [...]

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of potassium bromate on physical properties and structure of flour doughs
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There are many factors which cause a variation in the baking strength of wheat flour, i.e. the capacity of a flour to yield large light, fine-textured loaves of bread. Above all, the quality of the wheat from which the flour is milled is of prime importance. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Marlowe’s "Jew of Malta" : a critical study
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the biographical sketch of Christopher Marlowe which prefaces his 1818 edition of The Jew of Malta, Oxberry wrote: "Of his (Marlowe's) family we know absolutely nothing; their very names are forgotten...Ali the genius or Marlowe...has not had the power to save the records of his life from oblivion." [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: English
Marlowe, Christopher, 1564-1593. Jew of Malta

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The north China plain : a regional study
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The North China Plain is an important section of the earth's land surface, for its sheer size, its long written history, and its ability to support a dense population. It is part of the Great Plain of China, one of the world's largest agricultural lowlands, comprising the land between the mountains and the sea, the valleys of the Yellow, Hwai, Yangtze, and many smaller streams. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geography
China -- Geography

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An Investigation of the chemical composition of the leaf-fall from deciduous forest trees before and after partial decomposition
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Podsol soils have been intensively studied ever since the middle of the last century, yet the mechanism of their development is still obscure. In view of this lack of knowledge regarding podsolization and because these soils are the dominant agricultural soils of Eastern Canada, an investigation of the fundamental processes responsible for their development was started at Macdonald Collage in 1947. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The action and use of colchicine in the production of tetraploid buckwheat (Fagopyrum esculentum)
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The demonstration of the value of colchicine as an agent for chromosome doubling has opened a large reservoir of possibilities in plant breeding work. According to Muntzing (1936), "more than half of all the angiosperms found in nature are polyploids and some others have been produced experimentally." [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Genetics
Colchicine
Buckwheat

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Heat and mass transfer in dehumidification
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In the innumerable places in industry where heat is generated, applied, or dissipated, it must pass from some relatively hot body to one at a lower temperature. This particular physical phenomenon and the laws governing the molecular, electronic and wave motions involved is theoretically studied under the familiar heading of "heat transfer". [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemical Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Calibration of variable compression internal combustion engine with standard fuel and investigation of performance with fuel 3GPX22
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The effect of varying the compression ratio of internal combustion engines has been well known for some years. Research engines have been built from time to time with the feature of variable compression ratio. The main difference of this engine from American and British internal combustion engines is that the fuel is injected into the cylinder in the "solid" state and the inlet valve admits only air to the cylinder. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mechanical Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Kinetic studies of a redox polymerization
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The development of emulsion polymerization has been one of the most important steps in the evolution of a commercial synthetic rubber. The main advantage of this type of system lies in the degree of control over the polymerization reaction which it affords. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Statistical analysis of the compositions and related properties of cast steel
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: With the increased use of weldments and other alternate methods of fabrication over the past few years, there has been much interest in the foundry industry in improving the quality and over-all reliability of steel castings. In recent years, also, the efficiency of the acid-electric steelmaking process for the intermittent operation peculiar to the industry has been reflected by an increasingly larger proportion of the steel used to make castings produced by this method. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Metallurgical Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The variability of the vascular supply to the Ureter
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study of the arterial supply to the ureter was made because of the prevalence of injuries to the ureter in pelvic surgery and gynecologic complications to the ureter and kidney following pelvic intervention. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Anatomy

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on iron metabolism
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The experimental material to be reported in this thesis represents the results of work carried out by the writer since the end of World War II. The studies arose out of three large surveys which were carried out under the direction of Dr. O.F. Denstedt of this department during the war. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The medical social worker and the unmarried mother
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The large general hospital which has an obstetrical service plays an important role in the community in terms of maternal care. When, in addition, it maintains an outpatient clinic, it is in a position to encourage adequate pre-natal care as part of its programme. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Experimental production of gastric neoplasms in the rat
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Cancer of the stomach is the most frequent of all malignant growths. Livingston and Pack in 1939 (121) have stated: "There are more deaths from cancer of the stomach than from all malignant tumors of lip, tongue, cheek, tonsil, pharynx, larynx, salivary glands, thyroid, male and female breast, ovary, uterine cervix and corpus uteri combined." [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: High energy nuclei emitted under proton bombardment
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An understanding of the mechanisms operating in nuclear reactions produced by high energy nucleons is of considerable interest. The experimental investigation of these processes may be grouped into two categories: l. Measurements are made of the excitation function for the production of a certain isotope. 2. The energy and angular distributions of the emitted partiales are studied. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the preparation of estrone-16-C14 and the study of its metabolism
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1916 Lanthrop and Loeb (l) demonstrated a diminished incidence of spontaneous mammary cancer in female mice of known high incidence strains as a sequel to castration. This observation clearly implicated the ovarian hormone secretions (2), acting in conjunction with hereditary factors, in the transformation of normal to cancerous tissue in the mammary gland. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The English cloth economy, 1550-1640
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The economic revolution which transformed England from a grower and exporter of raw wool, to a producer and purveyor of manufactured cloth, began and was in a large part accomplished during the fourteenth century. [...]

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The capacitor motor
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The basic principle of the method of three-phase symmetrical components is the resolution of any particular set of vectors, current or voltage, in the three-phases of an unbalanced electric circuit into three sets of balanced three-phase vectors, i.e., the positive-sequence, negative-sequence and zero-sequence symmetrical components. rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The immunospecificity of steptococcal hyaluronidases and some of their properties
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This experimental investigation was undertaken with the hope that further information would be acquired concerning the properties of streptococcal hyaluronidase and the immunological specificity of its antienzyme. The potential and present importance of serum antihyaluronidase in the blood of individuals inflicted with various diseases is rapidly becoming recognized. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Bacteriology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Non-relief services in a family agency
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Clients tend to bring all their personal, familial and financial problems to a family agency. At the agency they are interviewed by professional social workers with a view to giving help in the area of the client's need. This professional help is called social casework. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The role of the medical social worker in helping patients at the Royal Victoria Hospital to accept and use a referral to the psychiatric service when their original request was for treatment of their physical complaints
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Great progress has been made by medical science today toward the successful treatment of many diseases so that they no longer present the same threat to man's existence. Along with this, increasing attention is being directed toward those patients who return again and again to the clinic or the private doctor with complaints for which no organic basis can be found. rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Effect of anterior and posterior lesions in the cerebral cortex of rats on performance in the closed field intelligence test
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A recent study by Lansdell (20) demonstrated rather conclusively that deficit in performance on a 'closed-field' test of rat intelligence was very closely associated with degeneration in the lateral geniculate nucleus, the most reliable indication of loss in the primary visual system. rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The role of the social worker in home care planning
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study is concerned with cancer patients who are cared for at home during some part or their teminal illneas. The problem of chronic illness and disability, of which cancer is only one major cause, is an ever increasing one. A higher incidence of chronic illness can be expected in the years to come because the life span has grown longer, and degenerative diseases become more prevalent as the individual grows older. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The efficacy of advertising expenditures: the consumers’ view
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The weave of life is a complexity of ethical and economic decisions. The 'design for living', the pattern which would be recorded in the annals of time should anyone take the trouble, is essentially the changing system of 'ends' towards which our endeavours have been directed over the years.
